result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Prudencio Medina-Hernandez

records.addlTxt: The 9/8/22 'Cash bond forfeited' entry is in error.  The surety asked for a bail forfeiture hearing.  sb
No reply from the defendant or surety.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($5,000.00) LW
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 5000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Prudencio Medina-Hernandez not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The defendant having failed to appear with the conditions of his release, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Prudencio Medina-Hernandez in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Natalia Fajardo appears by video. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to technical issues the defendant is unable to use the interpretation feature. Defendant to appear in person on the next date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Prudencio Medina-Hernandez in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter: Enrique Barbosa appeared by video.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense requests an adjourment to meet further with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

22RM021279  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/19/2022

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Prudencio Medina-Hernandez in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Prudencio Medina-Hernandez in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prudencio Medina-Hernandez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defense argued motion to dismiss count 1.  Motion to dismiss by state, argued and denied. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
